channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Debris over 3 weeks ago uncleared, 10th November
item.description:
Debris from crash yet to be cleared. What are your street cleaning team actually doing as the pavements are still filthy. Are there cleaning the pavements or just walking up and down the road. Maybe you should come and check.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowes Road, New Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip, 10th November

item.title: Rotten tree stuck stump , loose , all over the pavement , mud everywhere, 10th November
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipped unwanted items Hackney Council hasn't cleaned this area up properly only done a small proportion. Glass everywhere over the floor very dangerous for animals and small children and families in area on family days out. Hackney Council stop being lazy and clean this mess up. It is not fixed until you clean it up., 9th November
item.description:
Dumped on wanted items.

item.title: Six-year-old girl, she was hit by an electric bike, she has a closed tib/fib fracture." The little girl they are talking about is Frida. She was out playing with friends in the park at the weekend when she was hit by someone on an electric bike. It fell on her, breaking her tibia and fibula – bones in her lower leg. Your hackney council only care about investment and money from these anti-social behavior line bikes. Is bikes are wrecking people's lives and causing injuries., 9th November
item.description:
Line bikes causing antisocial behavior,injuries to minors. Hackney Council get your act together and address issue of line bike nuisance, antisocial behavior causing harm to pedestrians public spaces, parks where children play.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic bollard needs cementing in securely, 9th November
item.description:
I reported this outside 182 Rowle Avenue and it's been marked as fixed now. But it hasn't been fixed. It is in the ground upright but not secure and keeps falling over. Please can someone investigate properly to ensure it's cemented back in properly. I can only think that the wrong bollard has previously been looked at. I have reported this several.times now and it's not been fixed. It's dangerous especially as this bollard sometimes gets knocked into the road and that is a hazard too

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 180, Rowley Avenue, Blendon, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
